TestCase.TestCaseTitle: Handling of unsupported object in the C2IS.
TestCase.TestCaseObjective: To verify that the National MIP solution can display some information or a generic symbol to users if it receives an unsupported object.
TestCase.TestCaseScenario: Nation A creates some BSOs in its C2IS that are not supported by Nation B's C2IS. Nation B receives the unsupported objects. Its C2IS displays some information or generic symbol for the objects.
TestCase.TestCasePreCondition: Nation A has published a topic. Nation B has subscribed to Nation A's topic.
TestCase.TestCaseConclusion: The test is passed if Nation B receives the unsupported objects and displays some information or a generic symbol.

TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepAction: Nation A creates objects that are not supported by a symbol in Nation B's C2IS. Comments The desired behaviour of a receiving system encountering an object for which it has no mapped message element is to display the object using a generic symbol. In order to know which objects Nation B does not support (this objects also have to be ones which nation A itself supports in order for them to be created), the results of each nation from the SLT3IS symbology related tests can be cross-checked.
TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepResult: Nation B's C2IS displays some information or a generic symbol for the objects created by nation A.
